Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fly L
Reviews.Content: i have been in istanbul in last january and i stayed in samir hotel , it was good place , the location is really good , 10 min walking to Sultan Hassan and Aya Sofia and grand bazzar , you also can find alot of restaurant , they staff was really nice and helpful specially mustafa , he gave us all the info we needed and it was really usful , our room was clean , it was nice , i booked a tour to princiss island through them , it was bit expensive but it was good in same time , highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, but overpriced and basic”
Reviews.Author: GarryOwen78
Reviews.Content: I would normally give a hotel like this an "average" rating, because it does have its good points, but I felt that at around 80 euros a night it was severely overpriced. It's a 15 minute walk to the main sites, but I wouldn't choose this area again - it's teeming with low-quality clothes retailers who continually pester every foreign-looking passerby. The hotel seemed clean, which is obviously a good thing, but that's not enough to merit a four-star rating. By EU standards this would be a 2-3 star - for example, I stayed at a 2-star Ibis in France that was much nicer. The Wi-Fi didn't work, which was enormously inconvenient, and meant I had to go out hunting for Wi-Fi elsewhere. On checking in, I was required to pay for all four nights up-front - this is an unusual requirement, and sends a very bad signal to the guest. The room was very small and a bit gloomy. The window opened on a quiet, narrow street, but with no view to speak of. The staff were actually fine, and one of them spoke good English. There's a five-star review below that seems to me to have been written by a non-neutral party. I can't prove that, but it seems fairly clear. That should be enough to send alarm bells ringing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with healthy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Christer L
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location and is very good value considering the rate. Very clean rooms. The english of several of the staff is not that good but they are friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is basic but full of stuff that is good for you. I.e. no bacon or greasy sausages but lots of fresh vegetables and such. The hotel was a perfect "home base" for us exploring Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Handywoman9
Reviews.Content: Near the tram line which is a must in Istanbul. Walking distance to Grand Bazar. Nice rooms and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: keitthmmm
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception and service. Very professional and friendly staff especially the Manager Mr. Ahmet. Rooms are comfortable and so clean. Location is within walking distance from all major attractions,tram station,restaurants,shops. A beautiful, small hotel with a warm, welcoming atmosphere I enjoyed the buffet breakfast of local cuisine We will definitely stay there again. Thank you. keith

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: zaminabs
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed by this so called 4 star hotel. The room a double room but only had a small 26 inch tv in the corner. Breakfast was limited, mostly Turkish food. The staff in the restaurant are eager to clear your plates even if you havenâ€™t finished! This made me very angry. Staff did not seem to know about the local area. The hotel is very clean and places high emphasis on hygiene especially in the bathroom. Not a great city view, just another standard hotel opposite. Only 1 person per each floor can access the wireless at a time. Overall a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, "fantastic service.â€�”
Reviews.Author: YagmurTas
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Istanbul several times and would rate Samir Hotel as the best I have stayed in. The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street with rooms overlooking the street as well as an interior patio. The rooms in the hotel are spacious, extremely well appointed the beds are super comfy and a huge rating for cleanliness. The breakfast was excellent great service and enjoyed the relaxing roof top overlooking the great view. What I found incredibly charming about the hotel was its lovely space for dining as well as comfortable sofas to hang out. The Hotel is located in the heart of Sultanahmet area and just a few minutes from all major attractions. What makes Samir Hotel truly special is the warmth and friendliness of the staff and the very high level of service. The staff was delightful and thoughtful in trying to respond to all our requests. A special thanks to Kadir he is an absolute gem he is very welcoming, very helpful and goes out of his way to ensure that the hotel guests have a good stay. I am definitely planning to stay at Samir Hotel during my next visit to Istanbul and highly recommend it to all.
